comment: Professor Reed is well-versed in what she teaches. She can be tough when necessary, though she is fair, going as far to offer opportunities to do have lower grades replaced with higher ones depending on the category. She values creativity and innovative thinking, and is always ready and willing to help where she can. 10/10 instructor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Had to grind so hard for my A and I'm a straight A student. No makeups for any reason even if circumstances are beyond your control. Just spare yourself and take someone else. Exams are proctored with camera. Don't know how she's not rated lower

Ridiculously hard grader. Group project criteria is just absurd and has to be a 15 minute long presentation. No make ups under ANY circumstances. This is such an easy class that is just blown out of proportion and made so difficult. Avoid at all cost and if not best of luck to you and get ready to spend hours a week just on this class.

So many assignments in total for this course it's exhausting. Nonetheless, her criteria for the final project is overwhelming and just too much. I'm a straight A student and this class is my first B. She also does not allow any makeups under any circumstances. Her exams are difficult and do not contain information she taught in the class.

I have been A/B Honor roll and this is the first class I got a C in, and that was barely, test are too short of a time limit to take, grades are all over the board, also multiply platforms for discussions, deducts for every little mistake, stated our class average score on the group project was only a 80. No late work accepted, basically her way

Not a fair grader. She is an inconsistent grader who does not properly explain feedback for lost points on assignment. She also does not respond to emails and when she does, is not considerate about it. She will not take late work for any reason. She is a tough grader, she marks off a significant amount of points even if 1 minor thing is wrong.

Reed is awesome; she has a lot of experience and is very motivating. That said she is a harsh grader, you have to read a lot, & there's a heavy course load but Mark Strat is a capstone so that's expected. Read the book BEFORE class & take notes - will save your quiz grade, most of the time the questions are straight from the book. Get a good group.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: We had one group project that we worked on throughout the whole semester. The lectures were enjoyable and would definitely take the class again!

Had Dayna Reed for Consumer Behavior 3150. She was pretty good. There a 3 big tests (open note with handwritten notes) and projects mainly she grades. 

She a great resource to use outside of class as well for help with resumes and with tackling the real world in terms of job readiness. Her tests are not easy but they are not impossible.

All you have to do is go to class and take notes. You can use HANDWRITTEN notes on tests, but they are in person. there is a group project and 3 essays (500 words each). overall, just a marketing psychology class

Quizzes are lockdown, but no camera. The tests are lockdown with camera and are challenging, but she provides a study guide that can be beneficial. There is a semester long group project that she grades hard. There are also weekly discussion posts followed with two responses to other classmates.

Prof Reed was awesome. The class seems difficult at first, but upon understanding the assignments better, I really enjoyed myself! Don't let MarkStrat freak you out. It is a lot to learn, but super fun when it clicks. I took this class as a MayMester, and I think it is a great way to do this class. Highly recommend!
tough grader
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Make sure to read the book and take notes ahead of time. The quizzes are open note. She's a harsh grader but is willing to help. Markstrat determines a lot of your grade, so make sure you pick a good group or else you won't get an A in the class. Also, she's very helpful when it comes to reviewing resumes.

This class is difficult as it is the capstone class but it is fun! You will learn a lot and enjoy showing up to class. She does grade hard on the assignments, you think she is sweet and nice until you get your grade back, so whatever you think is enough, do more work on it. Overall, she is a good professor who wants you to put in the work for class
Take your own notes, she will let you se them on tests/quizzes. Genuinely wants every student to pass and be the best they can be.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Reed is a solid choice for MKTG3100. Weekly quizzes and discussions that do not require lockdown, HOWEVER there are four exams that DO require respondus lockdown browser. Otherwise, there is a big group project but she gives you lots of feedback which makes it manageable!

This class was pretty relaxed for me. You do have a group project, but with 5 people, your workload is not a lot. Handwritten notes are allowed on quizzes and exams. 4 exams (40%), Group project (40%), In-class assignments such as attendance days, quizzes, and group workdays (20%). As long as you come to class and listen, you should do great.

Dayna was good! There are four tests including the final, a big ass group project, pop quizzes, video discussions, and attendance. She gave 30 points of extra credit and was always willing to help. SUPER accessible outside of class as she even gave out her phone number! She was really nice and gave a great teacher overall. 10/10 would recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Dayna is a phenomenal professor; if you can manage to get into her class before it's full, do it! Tests are open note. Go to class & take notes if you want a good grade. The project is time-consuming but very interesting if you choose something you're passionate about. She really cares about her students and will offer to help you if you ask.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: By far one of the best professors I had at Kennesaw, if not the best. She is so down to earth and really focuses on teaching her students real world application that will help them advance in their future careers. I have spoken with executives from her former job at Racetrack that state that the company is in a worse place without her. KSU is lucky

The group project is kind of a nightmare bc it's teams of 5. However, she was always available to talk about issues & offer help. She lets you turn in rough drafts to get feedback so that you do well on the final submission. Her lecture videos make learning the chapters easier & the exams are straightforward. She's really caring and approachable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Professor Reed is a great teacher and makes herself available to her students. The group projects are a big time investment and a lot of work but they were not fluff. Everything you do in her class will help you with as a professional and as a student. She offered to look over everyone's resume and give feedback which I found very helpful.

I loved Professor Reed She is very knowledgable about marketing and incorporates her real world knowledge into the class. Detailed lectures and powerpoints. Also provides an easy to follow schedule with the syllabus. Held study sessions prior to the exam & offers extra credit. Tests are nearly impossible but there are many other grades to balance.
Shes a good professor but not sure how this class is reviewed as amazing??

Dayna Reed is absolutely amazing. I took her during a Maymester and I thought it was a great way to knock out this hard course. Markstrat is difficult in general but she helps as much as she can and is happy to answer any questions you have. Make sure you participate and study. This class requires a lot of outside of class time! Take Dayna! :)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I took professor Reed for an online Maymester, and I was really nervous it would be super hard. The MarkStrat simulation is hard within itself, but she does a great job at helping to guide you towards success. She cares about making sure you understand and doesn't make you feel dumb for asking questions.

MarkStrat is just hard. There's no helping that, but she made is so much easier. She would join our group meetings. She would answer any questions she could to help us. She helped me so much even outside of class. She's really knowledgeable overall with the material and marketing in general. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Professor Reed is definitely a great choice for online Marketing 3100. We had a quiz over each chapter (not hard at all), and she gave you a study guide for each of the four multiple choice tests (webcam lockdown browser and not hard). Emails back quickly. Group project is big but having three other team members makes it manageable. Take her!!

Reed was a solid professor for marketing. There is a quiz at the end of each class which counted as your attendance so you do have to pay attention. Tests were easy A's if you study (thought they would go over large amounts of chapters). The group project is the most difficult part but you can get an A on it as long as your group does their work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria
